infovis.utils
Class Permutation

java.lang.Object
  infovis.utils.Permutation
All Implemented Interfaces:
cern.colt.function.IntComparator, RowComparator, Serializable
public class Permutation
extends Object
implements RowComparator, Serializable

Maintain a permutation of indices.

Maintain two tables called direct and inverse.

The direct table usually is the result of a indirect sort over a column. It contains the index of the rows sorted in a specific order. For example, if a table containing {6, 7, 5} is sorted in increasing order, the direct table will contain {2, 0, 1}.

The inverse table contains the index of a given row. With the previous example, it contains {1, 2, 0} meaning that the index or rows {0,1,2} are {1,2,0}.

Version:
$Revision: 1.18 $
Author:
Jean-Daniel Fekete
